poem:
In Memoriam: David Williams  
  
The quiet hands of service,  
etched in the lines of time,  
a guardian of the healing halls,  
a voice in the assembly of care.  
In corridors of labour's light,  
he wove his life, threadbare—  
yet strong, a tapestry of resolve,  
for those who walk the hospital's path.
